node.title: How to Output the Value of Residual and Jacobian Terms at Each Time Step
node.bodyText:
Hi All,
I have a question about the ComputeQpResidual and ComputeQpJacobian in the KernelValue. Is it similar to the AMATRX and RHS of UEL in Abaqus? If yes, how can I obtain the value of the Residual term (RHS) and Jacobian term (AMATRX) since I want to compare their value at each time step in MOOSE and Abaqus to compare the numerical differences of the matrix?
Thank you and Best wishes,
zc

Hello
You ll want to use the matrix and vector tag capabilities (see the parameters on each kernel), then output them using the TagVector/MatrixAux
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/framework_development/tagging.html
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/auxkernels/TagVectorAux.html
Guillaume
Be aware that TagMatrixAux only outputs the diagonal entries. I'd recommend using petsc printing routines instead. Refer to the petsc manual please.
Thanks for both of your advice. I will try them all.

node.title: Adding custom kernel to Navier-Stokes module
node.bodyText:
Hello,
I developed a custom kernel myself. Is there any way that during compilation this can be added to navier_stokes-opt, so it can be compiled with other kernels? For example, I added the .h and .c file of my custom kernel to Navier-stokes module and it did not work (include/kernels and src/kernels folders). What is the correct means of adding our custom kernels to existing MOOSE kernels and compile everything together?
Thanks,
Ali
#23254 (reply in thread)

node.title: Assigning separate block_ids to different domains from an imported mesh.
node.bodyText:
Hello,
I have a mesh consisting of two domains (caprock and aquifer) that I imported using the FileMeshgenerator. I want to assign these domains to separate blocks—for example, caprock on block 0 and aquifer on block 1, so that I can specify different material properties (e.g., porosity, permeability and capillary pressure) to these domains. I’m, however, getting the following error when I run my simulation. Perhaps the way I assign the blocks is incorrect. Could anyone please help? I attached my input file. Thanks.
*** ERROR ***
The following error occurred in the object "MOOSE Problem", of type "FEProblem".

Material property 'PorousFlow_relative_permeability_nodal', requested by 'ad_flux_co2' is not defined on block aquifer_TRI3
Material property 'dPorousFlow_relative_permeability_nodal_dvar', requested by 'ad_flux_co2' is not defined on block aquifer_TRI3
Material property 'PorousFlow_relative_permeability_nodal', requested by 'ad_flux_water' is not defined on block aquifer_TRI3
Material property 'dPorousFlow_relative_permeability_nodal_dvar', requested by 'ad_flux_water' is not defined on block aquifer_TRI3
Material property 'PorousFlow_relative_permeability_nodal', requested by 'ad_flux_co2' is not defined on block caps_TRI3
Material property 'dPorousFlow_relative_permeability_nodal_dvar', requested by 'ad_flux_co2' is not defined on block caps_TRI3
Material property 'PorousFlow_relative_permeability_nodal', requested by 'ad_flux_water' is not defined on block caps_TRI3
Material property 'dPorousFlow_relative_permeability_nodal_dvar', requested by 'ad_flux_water' is not defined on block caps_TRI3

[]

Please, ignore this ticket. The input file is now working after I changed the extension of the imported mesh file from .inp to .msh. Thanks.

node.title: Why do scalar variables have components?
node.bodyText: What are these used for? Are they different degrees of freedom? How is it different from a vector variable?

Hello
Scalar variables live in a single global location. There are two main differences:

vector variables are currently fields, they have Qp spatially, while scalar variables have only a single value
vector variables have 3 components (libmesh_dim really), while the scalar variables can have as many components as desired

Guillaume
wrt to what they are used for, you ll have to imagine a problem with global variables that all have the same equation roughly

So if I want to have multiple scalar variables, do I just define just one in my input file and use different components with different scalar kernels? Or can I define multiple scalar variables and use the 0'th component on each?

it depends if the equations are very similar.
If you can write the equations in an "array" form, then it s really worth it to use scalar array variables.
If not then just use several scalar variables

node.title: How to set periodic BC?
node.bodyText:

Best
I mean, the upper boundary and bottom boundary

There s a periodic BC object you can try.
as long as the surfaces are well aligned it will work
I tried, there is no PeriodicBC object...Which object do you refer to?
You ll have to find the exact name in the source index

Thank you for your reply.
I want to set the BC of top and bottom boundary as periodic and remain the left and right as zero flux boundary condition.
I wrote a command as below:

Is this correct?
This should work as long as top & bottom match rigorously

node.title: error building documentation
node.bodyText:
Hi all,
I'm trying to build the html documentation for MOOSE on my computer (Mac OSX 12.4 Monterey). That would be very useful cause I'm working offline quite often.
When I do it from the "test" directory:
cd /home/user/projects/moose/test ./moosedocs.py build --destination [destination_dir]
it works smoothly. But as far as I understand, in order to replicate the documentation of the actual MOOSE website I must run the command in the "modules" directory.
When I do, I get:
MooseDocs.extensions.appsyntax (MainProcess): Failed to locate a valid executable in ${MOOSE_DIR}/modules/combined.
and then a lot of other errors about syntax not being found.
What am I doing wrong?
Thanks for any help,
N
The script looks for combined-opt and couldn't find it. You need to compile combined-opt in modules/combined.

You need to build moose/modules, and then run your moosedocs command from there. Like so:
cd moose/modules
make -j 6
cd doc
./moosedocs.py build --destination <destination dir>

that's great, thank you.
Now I wonder if it is possible to embed a local search engine, rather than the google driven one, which tries and connect to the web

node.title: Different Results in plasticity models
node.bodyText:
Hi,
I have recently been having problems with a thermal mechanical simulation with plasticity. I have implemented plasticity in the old tensor mechanics system through use of the TemperatureDependentHardeningStressUpdate material and in the new system with the ComputeSimoHughesJ2PlasticityStress material.  The stresses and strains in the cube differ greatly (approximately ten orders of magnitude) for the two models, despite the eigenstrains almost matching.
The model set up is as follows:
A cube of length 200mm made of titanium
Left face heated to a temperature of 2000K
Right face heated to a temperature of 300K
Left face of the cubes displacement is fixed in x, y and z
The cube has an initial temperature and stress free reference temperature of 1100K
The stresses and strains are measured at:
measurePoint0=5
measurePoint1=12.5
measurePoint2=25
I have curve fit the PiecewiseLinear hardening functions to use for the Simo-Hughes model.
I have attached the input files that produce the different results.
I would expect the stresses and strains to approximately match. Could this be a misunderstanding of the Simo-Hughes plasticity model or possibly be a bug?
Many Thanks
SimoHughes.txt
Isotropic.txt
Thanks for reporting. I'll look into this.

OK, so I compared the two material models (one setup with the old system, the other with the new system) at two different temperatures (T = 300 & 2000). The parameters are the same as yours. I am testing it on a single-element cube, and I am not solving for the temperature -- the temperature remains homogeneous, hence the eigenstrain.
See the figure below. The stress magnitudes are the same.

So the conclusion is the material model with the same hardening function has similar performance, regardless of which TM system you use.
The difference you see in your problem is probably due to different localization phenomena in the old and the new systems, as the formulations are different. The old system uses hypoelasticity, whereas the specific Simo-Hughes material in the new system uses hyperelasticity. Again, there is no single answer as to which formulation is better.
The input files I used can be found on this branch: https://github.com/hugary1995/moose/tree/old_new_TM_isotropic_plasticity_comparison
uhh, I see the problem here -- the Simo-Hughes material isn't accounting for the eigenstrain for some reason...
Converting this to an issue...

node.title: FV boundary condition - not registered
node.bodyText:
Hi. I am testing some FV modeling. I am using a simple input file with only FVDirichlet and FVTimeKernel, and FVDirichletBC. Running the code throws an error right away: "Task add_bc is not registered to build FVBoundaryCondition derived objects" I am a little puzzled by this: are not all FV objects in the main trunk repo registered to be built in a standard moose build?
Thanks,
Olle

Hello
It should not be in the [BCs] block, it should be in the [FVBCs] block
Guillaume

Hi Guillaume,
Haha I should have guessed that. Should all relevant blocks (Kernels, AuxKernels,...) have the FV prefix?
Thanks,
Olle

FVKernels yes
AuxKernels works though
OK, thanks.

node.title: Question about the Postprocessor  'PointValue '
node.bodyText:
Hi all,
As described in https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/postprocessors/PointValue.html , when using PointValue , it will throw an error if the point being sampled lies outside of the domain.
If we use it to get the variable at a point on the  surface of simulating object, there would be no mesh at the original location of the point because the mesh deforms during calculating, I want to konw whether this could cause an error or how to avoid it.
Thanks in advance!

Hello
You ll want to use the SideValueSampler, this will follow the mesh.
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/vectorpostprocessors/SideValueSampler.html
Otherwise you can try the use_displaced_mesh parameter but sampling on an external boundary is already iffy, you're depending on rounding errors placing the point inside the mesh
Guillaume

@GiudGiud  Thanks for your reply. Acturally I want to get the value at specific point on the surface,  but the SideValueSampler  cannot set a point parameter. As for the use_displaced_mesh parameter in PointValue , does it means by setting it to 'true' then it will keep following the original point I set even the mesh deforms?

see this explanation for the behavior of PPs under displaced meshes
#22935 (comment)

@GiudGiud Thanks.  So according to the explanation, to avoid the mesh displace casusing the point locates at unexist domain, I should set use_displaced_mesh = false , which is also the default option. Another question:
For getting variables on surface by using PPs, whether only the nodal variable can be obtained but elemental variable can't?

Elemental variables are not always defined on a boundary, they can be discontiuous there it depends on the variable type.
So it might not be supported to sample them on boundaries, as devs have been a little too careful banning elemental variables instead of banning discontinuous ones
Ok,thanks a lot for your kindly help! @GiudGiud

node.title: Cannot get peacock to work.
node.bodyText:
I am unable to get peacock to work from a fresh install of moose.
Upon trying to start peacock, I get the following error:
Error starting peacock: Could not import vtk

You may need to either create or load an environment providing PyQt, VTK, etc.
The MOOSE development team provides a conda package with the required dependencies:

	mamba create -n peacock moose-peacock python=3.7
	mamba activate peacock

Then run peacock again

When following these steps, I get the same error.
I've also tried to install vtk and PyQt manually through mamba, however when trying to install vtk on the moose environment I get the following error:
Encountered problems while solving:
  - package moose-libmesh-2022.11.07-build_0 requires moose-mpich 4.0.2 build_4, but none of the providers can be installed

Any help would be greatly appreciated!

Hello
Can you type mamba list in the peacock environment please
Guillaume

Can you try:
mamba activate peacock
python
>>> import vtk
>>> vtk.__file__
I am curious as to the error that may pop up. I am thinking there may be none at all... the error provided usually doesn't match the issue (we should probably try and solve that). Anyways, if no error, try to import more modules:
import PyQt5
from matplotlib.backends.backend_qt5agg import FigureCanvasQTAgg
If no error... lets next try to run a simple Chigger test (which I believe makes use of the same Qt/PyQt5) API.
mamba activate peacock
cd ~/projects/moose/python
export PYTHONPATH=`pwd`
cd ~/projects/moose/python/chigger/tests/writers/
./writers.py

Hello
Can you type mamba list in the peacock environment please
Guillaume
These are the packages in the peacock environment:

./writers.py

mamba create -n testing pyqt libclang=12 python=3.7 # works
mamba create -n testing pyqt libclang=12 python=3.8 # fails (or any higher Python version)
